fields.description:
It doesn't appear possible to change the sort order for filters displayed on the dashboard. Regardless of the sort order used to manage the filter, the dashboard always sorts by ID.

It would be really useful to be able to specify a sort order explicitly, or at least have the same sort order used to display the filter results both on the dashboard and within the filter editor.

As a side note, it would also be useful to add a "LIMIT" feature (a la SQL) so that I could configure my dashboard to show me the top 10 things that I've been assigned.
fields.summary: Sort ability missing from filters (I think)

fields.description:
Not sure which version I'm accessing (so I set it to version 1.4.3) - but here's what happened:

I entered a new feature request into Novissian's JIRA project.

I voted for it - as a feature - especially since I was the one who requested the feature and I also set the 'watched' flag ON.

Ok.

Then I went and requested a SECOND new feature.

Well guess what?

When I went to vote for it and set 'watched' to be true - it thought that I had already done that!

WRONG!

These settings have to be reset for EVERY feature - correct?

It's a bug!
fields.summary: Thought I had already voted and set watched

fields.description:
Eg: 
I had create me as user "admin" and as a developer in jira. 
When i try to get my admin password i only get a mail with my developer password. 
Could be a closed door, when the developer has no permissions.  ;-)
fields.summary: when more then one user has the same email, only the first user get a mail.
Allow multiple time estimates (development, QA, deployment, etc)

fields.description:
For many cases the mime-types of attachments that are uploaded are set to "application/octet-stream".

In most cases - this is not the case, and attachments should be served with the correct mime-types.

The activation framework seems to deal with this fairly nicely:

http://java.sun.com/j2ee/sdk_1.3/techdocs/api/javax/activation/MimetypesFileTypeMap.html

Also a list of mime-types:

http://www.utoronto.ca/ian/books/html4ed/appb/mimetype.html

We could automatically set the mime-type for uploads we know about.
fields.summary: Improve Mime type handling of Attachments

fields.description:
I wish to suggest that when you enter comments on the Log Work page, they should be appended to the comments thread rather than a separate Work Log thread.

Having used other bug trackers with similar tabbed interfaces before (Seapine's TestTrack), I have noted that any information not on the first page of a bug is ususally ignored.

Likewise, having used systems where all changes to a bug get appended to the same, front-page thread (Bugzilla, as well as our custom, in-house tracker), I have found it much more useful to have the entire converstational history of the bug in one thread, on one page.

In my opinion, any message a developer types about a bug needs to be in that main thread for everyone to read.
fields.summary: Log Work into Comments thread, instead of into separate tab

fields.description:
Javascript buttons on issue display are (IMHO) overkill.
They do nothing except location="bla bla", and could be
replaced by better looking gif images or just text
links. 

( I mena "comment" "edit" "attach" "resolve" etc. buttons )

Currently they are an problem in security aware environments, 
where javascript is disabled  - they just do not work
at all. 

So, now to change sttaus of issue I have to: 
1. Disable my ad filtering proxy ( which also 
kills javascript )
2. Turn javascript on 
3. Do what I intend to do
4. Repeat 2 & 1 in reverse order to put my
( maybe paranoid ) security in place. 

Link or cool graphic would do the job.
fields.summary: Remove javascript buttonf from  issue display

fields.description:
I suggest that you add possibility to save information about time spent in issue on 'resolve' screen.

Now I have to got to "Log work done", put spent time and then resolve issue. This is good if issue is 'big' and this option should stay. Sometimes issue is quick resolved and you want just close it and save information about time spent...

When you go to the project home you can see lists of issues assingnd to you.

I would like it to also show (in the whitespace area) a list of issues new since you last logged in.
fields.summary: Display new items since I last logged in

fields.description: The ideea is to be able to create an issue and specify which user group(s) are able to view it, since, for example, a development team should be able to create issues viewable only for their own group and NOT by everybody. Of course, issues created by regular users would be visible to all, by default.
Related to JRA-722, the UI label on the create/edit issue page is 'Component/s' which is confusing as only one can be selected.
I suggest that some comboboxes are added - for instance when selecting lead developer or (expecially) when linking issues. When linking now you have to remember issue id!

I need the ability for the project keys to be more complex (eg: MA_001_RR). As we run a large number of projects with a large number of developers.

The above can be broken down into MA_001 (maths project 1) followed by the developer id RR (rocketred). At the moment we have to convert this to MAONERR.

I think it would be very useful to assign users into departments.
Tickets could then be assigned to a department, and someone within that department could then take the ticket and work on it.

This would be great where you don't know which of Bob or Alice is likly to want to be assigned the ticket. You can just give it to their dept, and let their manager sort it out.
As opposed to the current case, where you have to know who to assign a ticket too, which means knowing a lot about the workloads of everyone in the company :-)

This is reproducable (for me at least) on jira.atlassian.com

If I click 'Profile' and then 'Watched Issues' under the 'Reports' bullet point, nothing happens - I just get the same profile screen.

This would be useful behaviour for me, especially on this site.

ta - Mike

Please could you consider adding a (optional) feature such that when using the 'find issue' page, each issue in the issue list has a 'increase priority' and 'decrease priority' button.

This is because the users at my site want to be able to more easily order the issues in an iteration.
fields.summary: Easy prioritisation in find issue list

fields.description:
LoginFilter should apply a request wrapper so that the getPrincipal() method of the HttpServletRequest is actually the OSUser User entity. Makes integration with WebWork trivial.

THIS COULD CAUSE PROBLEMS ON OTHER SERVERS...

Hi.

Looking at my roadmap report:

http://guests.atlassian.com/novissio/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10000&report=roadmap

I notice that items are only shown as "FIXED" or "UNRESOLVED" and never as "IN PROGRESS".

Regards,

Matt
fields.summary: Roadmap screen does not show correct status for "in progress" items

Not sure if this is a bug - maybe just pussled about its workings.
I had made a task with an estimate of 5 days.
Made one worklog that used 2 days and the remaining time showed 3 days
Made a final log that used 2 days and adjusted the estimate to 4 days - but then the remaining time said 4 days - I would expect that it said 0 days as I had already used 4 days out of an estimate of 4 days?
Making yet another log which only records 1 day used it again decrease the remaining time appropriately - but it looks ackward that it now reads estimated time remaining = 3 days and total time spent = 5 days
Is this the supposed behaviour?

After installing the 1.4.2 release onto JBoss I experience a very low performance and finally an error.
I have imported my data via XML from a running 1.2.1 installation.
I can log in but it takes above one minute from I press the login until I get the home screen. While processing a zillion lines are outputted in the JBoss console window.
I have attached a sample of the output

The log in time is also high on consecutive logins - so it can't be related to jsp compiling.
Finally when tying to acess an issue I get an error - I have attached the stacktrace from the error.
fields.summary: Poor performance & error on 1.4.2 on imported data

fields.description:
I just found out that there is a lot of work when creating permissions for a (new) project.

First, I have to create groups (that is ok). 
But then I have to assign every group permissions (user can just browse, manager can do everything,...).

So here is my idea.

Let me briefly explain our company system. We create several user groups for every project we use - users, developers, managers... So, we don't use integrated "jira***" groups, because permissions are project specific. Permissions of user form same group (project1-manager and project2-manager) have always same permissions. 
It will be wonderfull that I can say that for instance "project1-manager" group 'extends' "jira-manager" group. In global permissions I will then just put, that "jira-manager" can do everything and that mean that manager of project1 can do everything but just in project1, not in whole system.
It would be nice to have the issue count shown behind the version, e.g. in parenthesis. It would give a good feeling to see to have solved nearly 50 (or more) issues in a version.
fields.summary: Road-Map: show issue count behind the version

fields.description:
Link types could have an addiotional parameter to block the resolving of the parent issue if all child issues are not resolved. This could be set for link types such as "Required" or "Caused by".

It would help in managing complex problems or tasks and ensuring that everything gets done.
fields.summary: Link relations to block parent issue resolving if childs are not resolved

fields.description: Issue Navigator shows the same bug more then once!

After someone resolves a bug, you get a nice page, but on the page there is no way to go back to the list of bugs you were looking at before you selected it and resolved it.

As a developer, this is my 80% case workflow through the system: View Open bugs, select bug, fix bug, repeat.

To get back to the original list, i hit back several times and then refresh to see the change.

It would be cool if there were a link go back to the list of bugs from the resolved page.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-846].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6 November 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for providing your thoughts and votes on this suggestion. I know it's been a while since we last commented on this suggestion and I am sorry to have kept you so long without a clear answer.

As Jira server team we have once again reviewed how this suggestion is aligned with our strategy and priorities. I am affraid we are not planning to invest in support for subcomponents.

While we absolutely understand the logic behind many of the requests for subcomponents, we strongly believe that our focus should be on making Jira simpler and easier to use. Simply put, additional levels of hierarchy for components is likely to add complexity on a conceptual level, at a technical level (more bugs and slower performance) and will lead to a more confusing UI.

Meanwhile, there are several add-ons available on the Marketplace addressing the requirements outlined below:
 * [Component/Subcomponent/Bundle Versions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.deniz.jira.versioning/server/reviews] 
 * [Subcomponents for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.brokenbuild.subcomponents] 

Since investing in support for subcomponents is not aligned with our strategy and roadmap, we will be closing this issue. I understand that our decision may be disappointing but we also hope you will appreciate our candid and transparent appraoch. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Gosia Kowalska
Senior Product Manager, Jira Server
{panel}
*Original request description:*

As a person responsible for running the project I need to have the tools aligned with my projects' structures. My projects are organised in a large hierarchical groups of components. I need to be able to assign the JIRA issue to a whole group of components, as well as individually to any component within the system and be able to interact with issues in JIRA based on this assignment - i.e. all issues for component group, including both issues which are assigned to group as well as issues assigned to individual components within that group.

As far as I have evaluated the system, - and yes its great - I have nowhere found an opportunity of defining extra fields for an issue which extend the predefined attributes. I know that this will have strong influence on the filter mechanism but would help for a lot of applications even if it is a little bit outside a software develeopment context.

Best regards

--------------------------------------------
Building Bridges
-O-O-O-O------------------------------------

catWorkX GmbH
Dr.Wolfgang Tank
Stresemannstr. 364
22761 Hamburg
Tel.  +49 (0) 40 890 646-40
Fax.  +49 (0) 40 890 646-66
mobil +49 (0)172 420 444 2
email tank@catworkx.de
http://www.catworkx.de 
http://www.catbridge.de 
--------------------------------------------
Have you ever thought about generating release notes for a product / project automatically e.g. based on specific release note comments?

While the look and feel of JIRA can be customised to some extent with 1.4 there is currently no easy way to link to bespoke help files - this is necessary if you have created new issue types etc. The current option is to create help files from scratch and then edit all the JSP's to point to them.

What about packaging the help files with the EAR/WAR, at least that way the links will be intact and all that would reamin would be to edit the help HTML files and rebuild?
it would be nice to have issue numbers filter
There are no errors in server log.
fields.summary: When I click on Watched Issues Server goes down

fields.description: How to attch files in issues?
fields.summary: How to attch file in issues

fields.description:
I've set up the attachment directory at /usr/local/attachment and pointed JIRA to this directory.
 
When I create an attachement for an issue, the form returns with : 

Form Errors: 
Could not move attachment from /var/tmp/Jetty__8080___jira/hehehmn44018.gif to /usr/local/jira/attach/CWR/CWR-2/10021_hehehmn.gif 
 
the file is there under Jetty__8080__jira, and all directories have appropriate permissions.
 
The issue itself though.. if I view it again, I see that my attachement 'succeeded' (there is a link I can click) and it points to http://myurl.com/jira/secure/attachment/10021/hehehmn.gif
 
Any thoughts?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-838].
  {panel}

It would be useful if JIRA added some more headers to messeges sent. It will make easier to created filters on mail clients.

For example, I'd like to automatically archive emails JIRA sends me relative to the xdoclet project, but not to the xdocletgui project. In the current setup, the only way to differentiate these messages is searching the Topic field. This is not optimal.

So, let's suppose I create a field in my email message that looks for emails:

  1) Sent by legendaryservice@atlassion.com
  2) Topic starts with [JIRA]
  3) Topic contains XDT (the project key)

You see, there are two criteria based on topic. Not good. JIRA could add some custom header (like X-Jira-Project) to emails sent, so I could set up a filter based on that.
fields.summary: Add some custom headers to messages sent
After linking two issues, the issue isn't displayed anymore

fields.description:
When a new user is signed up they are e-mailed with this link:

http://myhost/jira/Dashboard.jspa/secure/ViewProfile.jspa

However, the link returns the following error:

HTTP ERROR: 500 String index out of range: -13
RequestURI=/jira/Dashboard.jspa/secure/ViewProfile.jspa 

Suspect there's an extra 'Dashboard.jspa' in there somewhere ;)
fields.summary: New users are getting a JSP error
Can add attachment when create new issue.

fields.description: I would like to be able to group issue reports by reporter & by assignee.

Quite often the comments I add to issues relate to future work and are almost journal entries.  It would be neat to have an option to "promote" a comment to a new issue.

This would use the create issue forms, filling in the comment text as an initial description and automatically offering to link to the "parent" issue.

When creating a comment it would be very helpful if you could see the last 'n' other comments as well as the description of the issue itself.  

n should probably default to something low like 3, but you should have an option to "show all comments".

For an example of how this works take a look at QuickTopic (www.quicktopic.com)
JIRA should allow each component to have an editable description.  The description should be visible in the UI, perhaps a tooltip (using the title="" attribute).
fields.summary: Allow Components to have a description
i18n: Filtering doesn't work for non-latin character encoding

fields.description:
We are currently looking for at system like Jira.
We need to show issues to our customers, both when reporting "issues", and to follow up on outstanding tasks. But we do not want to show all issues to the customers. We have som internal issues which will not make any sence to the customer - and it could be some internal issues which the customer really should'nt now about.
In our current mini-system using a simple access database, we have a view-level, and a edit-level. Each user is assigned a level, and can then see some issues and not edit them, and some issues can be edited. You can already handle the last per project, but we need it to be per issue.
Our levels are : 
1: Guest, 
2: Customer, 
3: intern sales
4: intern
5: delevopers
6: projectmanager

thanks in advance
 - Ren?
fields.summary: Possible to specify who can see specific issues within a project

fields.description: it would be nice to be able to give users within a project the ability to administer their own project -i.e. change project settings for that project and only that project (not other projects and not global settings such as global permissions, adding users, etc)

need to be able to set whether project permissions override global permissions or vice-versa, or whether they overlap.

why I need this - in order to allow users of a given group to close issues on a given project, I currently have to specify NO global permissions for this AND go to each specific project and set the default (jira-administrators) and on the one project add jira-administrators as well as notiva-testers.
See summary.
fields.summary: Remember sort order in the Saved Filters

fields.description:
I'm trying to find out how to close/resolve an issue so that the status is "Need More Info". 
 
I remember doing this at least once.  But can't get it now.  
 
Where is it?

it would be nice to have the ability to add a 'manager' component to the user definition, along with a correspondong search capability, so that managers can track the progress of items of their staff across multiple projects.

It looks like the only engine that support internatiolization is Orion.
All edit pages in Tomcat and Resin were shown with wrong encoding, for instance Edit Project, Edit Issue, New Issue, etc.
Some parts of resulting report contains wrong chars in place of non-english characters, for instance <title>, <reporter>, etc.
fields.summary: i18n: XML Export does not encode properly

fields.description: Look at JRA-782.
fields.summary: i18n: non-english characters in e-mails still shown as '?'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-819].
  {panel}

In step one of the "New Issue" form you are given a drop down to select the type of issue.

I would prefer to see a table with the following structure


-----------------------------------------------
 ( )  |  ICON   |   Description
-----------------------------------------------
 ( )  |  ICON   |   Description
-----------------------------------------------
 ....
-----------------------------------------------
 ( )  |  ICON   |   Description
-----------------------------------------------

This is a simple UI metaphor and re-inforces the meaning of the icons in relation to their description.

Matt
fields.summary: Modify Step 1 of the New Issue form

fields.description: Version is a concept well understood by a development team, but not to customers.  It would be helpful if a version could have additional information such as a text description and a target completion date which was available as information in the Road Map or on an individual issue next to the "Fix For" field as a link or popup.

Getting an IndexException when I attempt to reindex. This may explain the poor search results I'm getting!

See attachment for more info.

At the moment any issue added to the database is considered to be automatically verified and "good."

In an even remotely open environment this is unlikely to be always the case and it should be the responsbility of someone on the project to verify each issue before it is properly assigned.

I.e. that person should check that the issue is in fact a new issue, should check it is assigned to the right component, should assign it to the correct developer.

Changing the "verified" flag should require a privilege or membership of a particular group.

There should be a filter in the find display to show only unverified issues.  There should be an option in the project to only display verified issues by default.
fields.summary: Add status unverified, add verified filter

fields.description:
I would like to be able to remove the assignment of an item that remains to be assigned to someone.

My workaround is going to be to create a dummy "unassigned" user but I think this should be supported in the software.

Filters should also be able to show unassigned issues.
fields.summary: Add ability to remove assignment (i.e. make issue unassigned)

fields.description:
When displaying a list of all issues (specify, for example, "Fix for" = Any) the display should indicate which version the fix is specified for.

It should also have options to group issues by severity, by release and so forth.
fields.summary: When displaying issues for all versions the display is inadequate

fields.description:
By FAR the bulk of issues registered in the JIRA project are not assigned to a component.

This makes them very hard to browse through and digest.

Some effort should be given to assigning them to the correct components, creating new components as required.
fields.summary: All the Issues not attached to a component should be sorted into components

fields.description: When viewing the issue navigator as an Excel spreadsheet, the custom gif is not used (jira_logo_small.gif is used, the one with JIRA and stylized Atlas)

In the admin Look and Feel interface, the custom logo preview seems to be missing the port number.  Since I'm running JBoss on :8080, I get a little 'x' instead of my image.
 
This is not a problem for the actual logo at the top left.  But on the preview.

related?:
JIRA-525   JIRA-546
 
I arrived at work in the morning and checked my email. I had a few update emails from JIRA issues I had logged.  
 
With no current session on jira.atlassian.com, I clicked the following link in the email  (mike, you'd have this one too)... 

Subject: [JIRA] Updated: (JRA-804) Email Parsing Glitch

snip:
#####################################################################
The following issue has been updated:

    Updater: Mike Cannon-Brookes (mailto:mike@atlassian.com)
       Date: Wed, 18 Sep 2002 6:21 PM
    Changes:
[Fix For] changed from [1.4.2] to [2.0]

---------------------------------------------------------------------
For a full history of the issue, see:

  http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-804&page=history

---------------------------------------------------------------------
#####################################################################

When I clicked that link, the page displayed had seveal URLS with jsessionid inserted, and some without this value.  If I clicked 'Comments', the error page would appear with the note that it couldn't find that issue number (because it had the ; in it).
 
I wanted to attach the page, but no attachments.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.AttachFile.doExecute(AttachFile.java:53) 

when attaching


trying to get them to let me upgrade...

It would simplify backup procedure when front-end runs on different computer than the database. All neccessary data would be saved in one location, so backup of the database would be enough to have all JIRA data secured.
fields.summary: Ability to save attachments into the database

fields.description: This is a big problem! See mailing list post.
fields.summary: Under default setup, all new users are administrators

fields.description:
if you enter an email with an underscore it only links characters following the last underscore.
 
foo@foo.com
foo-1@foo.com
foo_foo@foo.com
foo_foo_foo@foo.com

If I report an issue, then I get all the emails:

[JIRA] Created: (EXT-4) foo
[JIRA] Updated: (EXT-4) foo
[JIRA] New comment: (EXT-4) foo
[JIRA] Closed: (EXT-4) foo

etc... 
 
I thought at first this was an interface issue.  On the interface it says that I'm not watching the issue.  So why do I get the updates?  I thought to maybe toggle the watch.  But even if I click this on and off, I *still* get the emails. So this must be because I'm the Reporter of the issue, right?
 
a few things:
It's somewhat confusing to see on the UI that I'm not 'watching' an issue, but I still get emails.  From this I figure that by 'watching' you must mean 'other interested 3rd parties besides the reporter and assigned developer (and project lead?)'.  I suppose the list of people to email updates to is a combination of the watch list, plus whatever hardcoded values are in the com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.mail.MailListener.  


second, as unlikely as it seems, can this be changed to allow anyone to choose to receive updates or not, on an issue by issue basis, including the reporter?  I'm not sure of the architecture, I haven't examined the code. But if it's like I think it is.. removing the hardcoded values, and simply making these people 'watchers' would allow for this customized feedback, and would fix the UI confusion as well.

If the system has only one project defined and creating new issue, step # 1 can be avoided by taking the project name by default (since it's only one project) and issue type entry can be moved to step 2.
fields.summary: Project Selection while creating new issue

fields.description:
When adding a new project, clicking "Create" returns to the input screen with no additional information.  No project is created.

We finally tracked it down to the URL: if you specify a URL without "http://", it will silently fail.
fields.summary: "Add Project" fails with no error message

fields.description:
We are about to use JIRA for issue & bug tracking.  A lot of our bugs and issues come from a community of 15,000+ users, and I would like to be able to add a list of watchers to our system that do not require account creation.  This would provide a level to escalate bugs & feature request to beyond the call tracking system that we use to handle incoming help desk emails.

This would take the form of (at least) a one time notification when an issue or bug is resolved, to the list of external users that are interested in knowing their issue is resolved.  For more detailed tracking, we would encourage them to create an account. 

Thanks!

Jack Miller
Keller-Williams Realty International
Development Manager
jackm@kw.com
(512) 306-7186

For any issue we have to store the customer (a text field where we store several keyes seperated by commas would be the easiest way) who raised that issue (best with an additional bug number which comes from the customers bug tracking system).
We have to create reports based on single customers so that we can inform them directly that their issues are done.

This is a buy / not buy issue.

We would like to fix bugs in old versions (we have normally 2-3 released and one future version open for fixes)
There is only one field "fixed for" version which does not allow us describe this process corectly.
For example:
We have 2.1.0, 2.1.1,  2.2.0 and work on all 3 versions because customer will not or cannot uprgrade for several reasons.
If we fix a bug and give the cusotomer a new version we derive from the > released versions a new on for example 2.1.1 SR1 (service release 1) or 2.1.0 SR2.
So the problem occurs: A new bug needs to be fixed in all releases, that means > it get fixed for 2.1.0 SR3 and 2.1.1 SR2 and 2.2.0 (which is not yet released).
You see, we need to fix bugs for several versions and cannot say fix bug starting with a version.

This is a buy/not buy issue for us.

It would be nice if there were an option to include a
<META http-equiv="refresh" content="xx"/>
tag in pages such as the issue navigator. Why? Because I've set my Active Desktop (on Win 2k) to point to a page which is one of my filter views, and I'd like it to update every 5 minutes (say).

Just another idea, feel free to ignore if I've gone nuts. :)
It would be cool if Jira supplied an RSS view of new bugs, changes, comments, etc. which could be aggregated into a portal.

There is a typo on the Resolve Issue page.

"If you have permission to close issues, you can optionally to resolve & close the issue at the same time."

should probably read

" If you have permission to close issues, you can optionally resolve & close the issue at the same time."

(Note removal of the word "to" after "optionally").
There is a type on the setup complete page. It says "You can now to login to JIRA". Should probably be "You can not login to JIRA".

fields.summary: code too large for try statement

fields.description: As requested on jira-user by Barry Kaplan.
fields.summary: Add preset filters to project browser

fields.description:
Recently installed jira on the above configuration, 
 
Posted several issues with 'allow unassigned issues' turned off.
 
All issues were assigned to the default users - the project admin.
 
When I enabled the 'allow unassigned issues' in the admin tool, and posted another issue, the email that is sent reports the issue field 'Status' as 'Assigned', while the web interface correctly reports it as 'UnAssigned'.
During the build process, files in edit/config should always overwrite any expanded files. This way you can add your own log4j.properties file that will get included in the final build.

There should be a simple way to reset the Edit Filter form to the default settings. 

Today, going from a complex filter to a simple search means you have to manually clear all fields that does not apply in the new filter. Some of the fields (status, resolutions and priorities) might have items selected that are hidden from view, which makes it too hard to see which settings that needs to be updated. A simple button to clear all settings and start from scratch would be helpful.
It would be nice to have a view of the road map (and perhaps the change log) that only shows issues assigned to me.

A little annoyance in the issue navigator:

Sort by assignee and sort by reporter seems to sort on usernames, but the full names are displayed. This is confusing. I think it would be much better to the full names when sorting, since that's what appears in the listing anyway.
fields.summary: Sorting by names is acting weird

fields.description: E-mail on issue update contains '?' chars in place of all non-english characters which are met in issue name, all descriptions, etc. The same are in subject and body of e-mail. It uses Win-1252 encoding instead of the right one (Win-1251 in my case).
fields.summary: i18n: non-english characters in e-mails shown as '?'

fields.description: I've added a comment containing a German ? (O with two dots over it, Windows-ASCII: 0xD6, Html: Ö), but it is not shown correctly when viewing the issue.
This would make it much easier to move all (!) issues of a version to another version, e.g. because you decided to not release a version 2.5, but a version 3.

To replicate:
- try to filter (ie on jira.atlassian.com) by 'type=bug' and 'project=jira'

When using project=any - it works fine.

fields.summary: Issue linking active page says 'issue tracking' :)

fields.description: We currently have development change the status to resolved when they fix the defect.  How do we allow the testers to change the status to close when they accept the change.
Fatal error in file:/opt/j2ee/atlassian/jira/jira-atlassian/atlassian-jira-web/secure/views/navigator/navigator-rss.jsp at line 178: Reference to undefined entity "?".

after executing a filter across "All Projects",
the header of the page lists the last individual project
I visited, not "All Projects". (the resulting list of 
projects is correct and does have multiple project issues).

1. Saved Filters and Preset Filters: With any Filter when click "Res" Column  to sort, get error msg "An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException" 

2. Preset Filters Assigned to me, Reported by me, Added recently, Updated recently show all Issues.

Clicking on the "Res" table header in the issue navigator results in the following error:

ERRORS: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException

I created a filter called "P? g?ng" and saved it.
Clicking on it gives the following result:

ERRORS: 
Could not load search with this name. 

It is also impossible to delete the filter.

(This does not happen if I set the character encoding to ISO-8859-1, but that breaks other things...)
fields.summary: i18n: Non-english characters in filter names

fields.description:
Create issue Step 2 (with assign permissions and not allowing unassigned issues):

In previous versions the project lead was selected by default as assignee for new issues. Now it defaults to the just the first option in the select box.

I liked it much better before.
fields.summary: Project lead no longer default for new issues

fields.description:
It seems like issue filters ignore the assignee field and displays issues assigned to any developer.

This bug appears when searching issues in one project. If "All Projects" is selected, the assignee filter works as excpected.

I would like to have the ability to re-assign the reporter of an issue.  This would be even more valuable for issues eventually reported via email.  It might also be useful to be able to make the reporter a guest user and tracked only via email.
fields.summary: Add ablity to re-assign reporter to another user

fields.description: If I view a project, then go to the Dashboard and click "Assign To Me", I see all the tasks but the header says "Project: PAWS". If I start my session over, it says "Issue Navigator". Basically, JIRA is trying to be too tricky :)
fields.summary: Assigned To Me still show "Project: Foo" instead of "Issue Navigator"

fields.description: When I click on a saved- or preset- filter, I'd like for the page to display what filter I just click on. Should be "trivial" :)
fields.summary: Display what filter you are looking at
